item.title: Main (Forward) Electronic Bay External Access Door Latch Pins

numlitem.para: Integrity of remaining pins is verified,
Remaining pins are verified to be fully engaged, and
Verification procedures are repeated each time the door is opened and closed.

note.para: If FWD EE BAY ACCESS DOOR is deferred as inoperative, do not open unless maintenance procedures are followed.

numlitem.para: Associated door indication may remain displayed.
Maintenance will verify the status of the affected door(s) and communicate this to the flight crew as appropriate.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FWD EE BAY ACCESS DOOR INOPERATIVE – DO NOT OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify integrity of closed door's remaining latch pins (from inside the aircraft in the Main Electronic Bay):
Remove the internal handle and door liner.
Visually confirm the integrity of the three remaining latch pins.
Replace the door liner and internal handle.
Confirm that the door handle is in the latched position.
Visually confirm the three remaining latch pins are fully engaged with their respective keeper fittings.
Verify the closed door's remaining pins are fully engaged before departure:
Check that the exterior operating handle is stowed flush with the door and is secured in the latched position by the handle latch.
Check that the door is flush with the fuselage skin.
Check that the door is latched by pushing inward on the door and verify that it does not move.
